comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: if the damage was not from battlecruiser shells, then it was indeed bombs from zeppelins in the raid on Yarmouth en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombardment_of_Yarmouth_and_Lowestoft

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Seems like it was the Zeppelin raid. This is likely not the battle linked to above, but the Zeppelin raid on Yarmouth and surrounding area on January 19, 1915. The raid, which killed 2 in Yarmouth and injured others, was the first aerial bombardment that killed people, and the first enemy action in England in 250 years, according to these accounts: www.kingslynn-forums.co.uk/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=1365&... www.gorlestonhistory.org.uk/worldwars/zeppelinairraid1915... The BBC used a slightly different photo, taken perhaps at the same time and the same spot, last January in a story about a plaque that was dedicated on the site of the bombing: www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-norfolk-16620650 A contemporary newspaper account: trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/72969115

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
Artolog:

Thank you for the links to articles about the zeppelin bombing of Yarmouth. Good to see the similar photo in the BBC article too.  We will add more details to the description of this image.
